radiographic_examinations.findings: Multiple loculated rim enhancing fluid collections in the right lower quadrant with extensive fat stranding centering about a dilated fluid-filled structure likely reflecting an inflamed appendix that has ruptured, measuring approximately 7.2 x 3.3 x 5.9 cm total. The largest fluid collection measures up to 3.8 x 2.6 x 2.2 cm. There is associated edema and hyperemia of the terminal ileum and cecum, reactive inflammation, and prominent mesenteric lymph nodes.
